metadata.title: Biblical Genealogy Dataset
metadata.description: Comprehensive genealogical dataset tracing lineage from Adam through Jesus Christ
metadata.author: Jared Lemons
metadata.license: Open for educational and research purposes

person.era: string (one of: pre-flood, post-flood, patriarchs, egypt, exodus, judges, united-kingdom, divided-kingdom, exile, post-exile, new-testament)
person.relationships: array of objects with target (person id) and type (mentor, disciple, successor, etc.)

people.significance: First man created by God, through whom sin entered the world
First woman created by God, mother of all living
First murderer who killed his brother Abel
Second son of Adam and Eve, murdered by his brother Cain
Third son of Adam and Eve, progenitor of the line leading to Noah
Son of Seth, during his time people began to call on the name of the LORD
Son of Enosh in the line from Adam to Noah
Son of Kenan in the line from Adam to Noah
Son of Mahalalel in the line from Adam to Noah
Walked with God and was taken away without experiencing death
Oldest person recorded in the Bible
Father of Noah, prophesied about his son's role
Built the ark by God's command and saved humanity and animals from the flood
Eldest son of Noah, ancestor of Semitic peoples including Hebrews
Second son of Noah, father of Canaan, cursed by Noah
Third son of Noah, ancestor of Indo-European peoples
Son of Shem, born two years after the flood
Son of Shem, ancestor of the Elamites
Son of Shem, ancestor of the Assyrians
Son of Shem, ancestor of the Lydians
Son of Shem, ancestor of the Arameans
Son of Arphaxad in the line from Shem to Abraham
Son of Shelah, possible namesake of the Hebrews
Son of Eber, in his days the earth was divided
Son of Eber, ancestor of many Arabian tribes
Son of Peleg in the line from Shem to Abraham
Son of Reu in the line from Shem to Abraham
Son of Serug in the line from Shem to Abraham
Father of Abraham, moved from Ur to Haran
Father of the faithful, received God's covenant, progenitor of many nations
Brother of Abraham, grandfather of Rebekah
Brother of Abraham, father of Lot, died in Ur of the Chaldeans
Wife of Abraham, mother of Isaac, received the promise at an advanced age
Egyptian handmaid of Sarah, mother of Ishmael
Abraham's wife after Sarah's death, mother of six sons
Nephew of Abraham, rescued from Sodom, father of Moabites and Ammonites
Firstborn son of Abraham, father of 12 princes, ancestor of Arab tribes
Son of promise, offered as a sacrifice by Abraham, father of Jacob and Esau
Wife of Isaac, mother of Jacob and Esau, favored Jacob over Esau
Son of Nahor, father of Rebekah and Laban
Brother of Rebekah, father of Leah and Rachel, Jacob's father-in-law
Firstborn son of Isaac, sold his birthright, ancestor of Edomites
Son of Isaac, received the birthright, father of the twelve tribes of Israel
First wife of Jacob, mother of six tribes of Israel including Judah
Beloved wife of Jacob, mother of Joseph and Benjamin
Rachel's maidservant, mother of Dan and Naphtali
Leah's maidservant, mother of Gad and Asher
Firstborn son of Jacob, lost his birthright due to his sin with Bilhah
Second son of Jacob, punished with Levi for the massacre at Shechem
Third son of Jacob, father of the priestly tribe, ancestor of Moses and Aaron
Fourth son of Jacob, received the kingly line prophecy, ancestor of David and Jesus
Fifth son of Jacob, from whom came one of the tribes of Israel
Sixth son of Jacob, from whom came one of the tribes of Israel
Seventh son of Jacob, from whom came one of the tribes of Israel
Eighth son of Jacob, from whom came one of the tribes of Israel
Ninth son of Jacob, from whom came one of the tribes of Israel
Tenth son of Jacob, from whom came one of the tribes of Israel
Eleventh son of Jacob, favored by his father, became ruler in Egypt, saved his family during famine
Twelfth and youngest son of Jacob, from whom came one of the tribes of Israel and King Saul
Only daughter of Jacob mentioned by name, involved in incident at Shechem
Daughter-in-law of Judah, mother of Perez and Zerah through Judah
Firstborn son of Judah, killed by God for his wickedness
Second son of Judah, refused to fulfill his duty to Tamar and was killed by God
Third son of Judah, not given to Tamar as promised
Son of Judah and Tamar, ancestor of David and Jesus
Son of Judah and Tamar, put his hand out first during birth but was born second
Egyptian wife of Joseph, daughter of Potiphera, mother of Manasseh and Ephraim
Firstborn son of Joseph, received blessing as half-tribe of Israel
Younger son of Joseph, received greater blessing from Jacob, became powerful tribe
Son of Perez, grandson of Judah, ancestor of David and Jesus
Son of Hezron, grandfather of Nahshon, ancestor of David and Jesus
Father of Nahshon and Elisheba (Aaron's wife), ancestor of David and Jesus
Wife of Aaron, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Nahshon
Leader of the tribe of Judah during the Exodus, ancestor of David and Jesus
Brother of Moses, first High Priest of Israel, ancestor of all priests
Prophet and lawgiver, led Israel out of Egypt and received the Ten Commandments
Prophetess, sister of Moses and Aaron, watched over infant Moses
Son of Nahshon, married Rahab of Jericho, father of Boaz, ancestor of David and Jesus
Hid Israelite spies in Jericho, joined Israel, ancestor of David and Jesus
Wealthy landowner who married Ruth, great-grandfather of David, ancestor of Jesus
Moabite woman who joined Israel, married Boaz, great-grandmother of David, ancestor of Jesus
Son of Boaz and Ruth, grandfather of David, ancestor of Jesus
Father of David, ancestor of Jesus, from whose root the Messiah would come
Second king of Israel, man after God's own heart, writer of Psalms, ancestor of Jesus
Wife of David after Uriah's death, mother of Solomon, ancestor of Jesus
Third king of Israel, known for wisdom and wealth, built the Temple, ancestor of Jesus
Son of David and Bathsheba, ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Son of Solomon, first king of Judah after the division of the kingdom, ancestor of Jesus
Second king of Judah, fought against Jeroboam of Israel, ancestor of Jesus
Third king of Judah, instituted religious reforms, ancestor of Jesus
Fourth king of Judah, godly king who brought reforms, ancestor of Jesus
Fifth king of Judah, married Ahab's daughter, walked in ways of kings of Israel, ancestor of Jesus
Sixth king of Judah, followed evil ways of Ahab's house, killed by Jehu, ancestor of Jesus
Eighth king of Judah, hidden as infant from Athaliah, restored temple worship, ancestor of Jesus
Ninth king of Judah, did right in the sight of the Lord but not like David, ancestor of Jesus
Tenth king of Judah, also called Azariah, prosperous reign until his pride led to leprosy, ancestor of Jesus
Eleventh king of Judah, did what was right in God's sight, strengthened Judah, ancestor of Jesus
Twelfth king of Judah, wicked king who introduced pagan worship, received sign of Immanuel, ancestor of Jesus
Thirteenth king of Judah, renowned reformer who restored Temple worship, received miraculous healing, ancestor of Jesus
Fourteenth king of Judah, notoriously wicked but repented in captivity, longest-reigning king of Judah, ancestor of Jesus
Fifteenth king of Judah, evil king who restored idolatry, assassinated by his servants, ancestor of Jesus
Sixteenth king of Judah, great reformer who rediscovered the Law, destroyed idolatry, ancestor of Jesus
Eighteenth king of Judah, vassal to Egypt then Babylon, burned Jeremiah's scroll, ancestor of Jesus
Nineteenth king of Judah, also called Jehoiachin or Coniah, taken captive to Babylon, cursed to have no descendants on throne, ancestor of Jesus
Son of Jeconiah, born in Babylonian exile, father of Zerubbabel, ancestor of Jesus
Governor of Judah who led first group of exiles back to Jerusalem, rebuilt Temple foundation, ancestor of Jesus through both lineages
Son of Zerubbabel, ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Son of Zerubbabel, ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Grandfather of Joseph (Jesus' legal father), ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Father of Joseph (Jesus' legal father), ancestor of Jesus through Joseph's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Legal father of Jesus, husband of Mary, descendant of David through Solomon
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Grandfather of Mary (Jesus' mother), ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Father of Mary (Jesus' mother), legal father-in-law of Joseph, ancestor of Jesus through Mary's lineage
Mother of Jesus Christ, highly favored by God, virgin who conceived through the Holy Spirit
The Son of God, Messiah, Savior of the world, fulfillment of Old Testament prophecies, founder of Christianity
Brother of Jesus, leader of Jerusalem church, author of the Epistle of James
Brother of Jesus
Brother of Jesus, likely author of the Epistle of Jude
Brother of Jesus
Sister of Jesus (referred to indirectly as one of Jesus' sisters)
